jaco.swing.autocomplete.ui

Class AutocompleteUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.plaf.ComponentUI
      • jaco.swing.autocomplete.ui.AutocompleteUI
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicAutcompleteUI

    public abstract class AutocompleteUI
extends javax.swing.plaf.ComponentUI
    UI for Autocomplete menu.

      AutocompleteUI()

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void acceptCompletion()
      Accepts the selected completion and performs insertion into the document to complete the token.
      abstract void ensureIndexIsVisible(int index)
      Scrolls the autocomplete menu within an enclosing viewport to make the specified cell completely visible.
      abstract java.awt.Rectangle getCellBounds(int index0, int index1)
      Returns the bounding rectangle, in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system, for the range of cells specified by the two indices.
      abstract int getCompletionCount()
      Returns the number of completions in the autocomplete menu.
      abstract java.util.List getCompletions()
      Gets the list of completions in the autocomplete menu.
      abstract int getFirstVisibleIndex()
      Returns the smallest list index that is currently visible, or -1 if nothing is visible or the autocomplete menu is empty.
      abstract int getLastVisibleIndex()
      Returns the largest list index that is currently visible, or -1 if nothing is visible or the autocomplete menu is empty.
      abstract java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
      Gets the preferred size of the autocomplete menu in the form of a Dimension object.
      abstract java.lang.Object getSelectedCompletion()
      Returns the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or null if there is no selection.
      abstract int getSelectedIndex()
      Returns the index of the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or -1 if there is no selection.
      abstract java.awt.Dimension getSize()
      Gets the size of the autocomplete menu in the form of a Dimension object.
      abstract java.lang.String getToken()
      Returns the current token to be completed.
      abstract int getTokenLength()
      Returns the length of the current token
      abstract int getTokenOffset()
      Returns the offset of the current token within the JTextComponent's document.
      abstract java.awt.Point indexToLocation(int index)
      Returns the origin of the specified cell in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system.
      abstract boolean isMenuVisible()
      Determines whether or not the autocomplete menu is visible.
      abstract boolean isPopupTrigger(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Returns true if the MouseEvent is considered a popup trigger by the autocomplete menu's currently installed UI.
      abstract int locationToIndex(java.awt.Point location)
      Returns the cell index closest to the given location in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system.
      abstract void refresh()
      Reloads the autocomplete menu.
      abstract void setMenuLocationInScreen(int x, int y)
      Sets the location of the upper left corner of the autocomplete menu using x, y coordinates.
      abstract void setMenuSize(java.awt.Dimension size)
      Sets the size of the autocomplete menu using a Dimension object.
      abstract void setMenuVisible(boolean visible)
      Sets the visibility of the autocomplete menu.
      abstract void setSelectedCompletion(java.lang.Object completion)
      Selects the specified completion in the autocomplete menu.
      abstract void setSelectedIndex(int index)
      Selects the completion at the specified index in the autocomplete menu.
      abstract void show(java.awt.Component invoker, int x, int y)
      Displays the autocomplete menu at the position x, y in the coordinate space of the component invoker.

    • Method Detail

      • isMenuVisible

        public abstract boolean isMenuVisible()
        Determines whether or not the autocomplete menu is visible.
        Returns:
        true if the autocomplete menu is visible

      • isPopupTrigger

        public abstract boolean isPopupTrigger(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Returns true if the MouseEvent is considered a popup trigger by the autocomplete menu's currently installed UI.
        Parameters:
        e - the MouseEvent to test
        Returns:
        true if the mouse event is a popup trigger

      • setMenuVisible

        public abstract void setMenuVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the autocomplete menu.
        Parameters:
        visible - true to open the autocomplete menu, or false to close it

      • setMenuLocationInScreen

        public abstract void setMenuLocationInScreen(int x,
                                             int y)
        Sets the location of the upper left corner of the autocomplete menu using x, y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the popup's new position in the screen's coordinate space
        y - the y coordinate of the popup's new position in the screen's coordinate space

      • getSize

        public abstract java.awt.Dimension getSize()
        Gets the size of the autocomplete menu in the form of a Dimension object.
        Returns:
        a Dimension object that indicates the size of the autocomplete menu

      • getPreferredSize

        public abstract java.awt.Dimension getPreferredSize()
        Gets the preferred size of the autocomplete menu in the form of a Dimension object.
        Returns:
        a Dimension object that indicates the preferred size of the autocomplete menu

      • setMenuSize

        public abstract void setMenuSize(java.awt.Dimension size)
        Sets the size of the autocomplete menu using a Dimension object.
        Parameters:
        size - the Dimension that specifies the new size of the autocomplete menu

      • show

        public abstract void show(java.awt.Component invoker,
                          int x,
                          int y)
        Displays the autocomplete menu at the position x, y in the coordinate space of the component invoker.
        Parameters:
        invoker - the component in whose space the autocomplete menu is to be displayed
        x - the x coordinate in invoker's coordinate space at which the popup is to be displayed
        y - the y coordinate in invoker's coordinate space at which the popup is to be displayed

      • getCellBounds

        public abstract java.awt.Rectangle getCellBounds(int index0,
                                                 int index1)
        Returns the bounding rectangle, in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system, for the range of cells specified by the two indices. Returns null if the given range is invalid.
        Parameters:
        index0 - the first index in the range
        index1 - the second index in the range
        Returns:
        the bounding rectangle for the range of cells, or null

      • ensureIndexIsVisible

        public abstract void ensureIndexIsVisible(int index)
        Scrolls the autocomplete menu within an enclosing viewport to make the specified cell completely visible. Does nothing if the given index is outside the range of the menu's cells.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the cell to make visible

      • locationToIndex

        public abstract int locationToIndex(java.awt.Point location)
        Returns the cell index closest to the given location in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system. Returns -1 if the model is empty.
        Parameters:
        location - the coordinates of the point
        Returns:
        the cell index closest to the given location, or -1

      • indexToLocation

        public abstract java.awt.Point indexToLocation(int index)
        Returns the origin of the specified cell in the autocomplete menu's coordinate system. Returns null if the index isn't valid.
        Parameters:
        index - the cell index
        Returns:
        the origin of the cell

      • getFirstVisibleIndex

        public abstract int getFirstVisibleIndex()
        Returns the smallest list index that is currently visible, or -1 if nothing is visible or the autocomplete menu is empty.
        Returns:
        the index of the first visible value

      • getLastVisibleIndex

        public abstract int getLastVisibleIndex()
        Returns the largest list index that is currently visible, or -1 if nothing is visible or the autocomplete menu is empty.
        Returns:
        the index of the last visible value

      • getSelectedIndex

        public abstract int getSelectedIndex()
        Returns the index of the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or -1 if there is no selection.
        Returns:
        the index of the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or -1 if there is no selection.

      • getSelectedCompletion

        public abstract java.lang.Object getSelectedCompletion()
        Returns the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or null if there is no selection.
        Returns:
        the selected completion in the autocomplete menu, or null if there is no selection

      • setSelectedIndex

        public abstract void setSelectedIndex(int index)
        Selects the completion at the specified index in the autocomplete menu. Does nothing if the given index is out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the completion to select

      • setSelectedCompletion

        public abstract void setSelectedCompletion(java.lang.Object completion)
        Selects the specified completion in the autocomplete menu.
        Parameters:
        completion - the completion to select

      • getToken

        public abstract java.lang.String getToken()
        Returns the current token to be completed.
        Returns:
        the token invoking this Autocomplete

      • getTokenOffset

        public abstract int getTokenOffset()
        Returns the offset of the current token within the JTextComponent's document.
        Returns:
        the start offset of the current token from the beginning of the JTextComponent's document

      • getTokenLength

        public abstract int getTokenLength()
        Returns the length of the current token
        Returns:
        the length of the current token

      • refresh

        public abstract void refresh()
        Reloads the autocomplete menu.

      • getCompletions

        public abstract java.util.List getCompletions()
        Gets the list of completions in the autocomplete menu.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of the displayed list of completions

      • getCompletionCount

        public abstract int getCompletionCount()
        Returns the number of completions in the autocomplete menu.
        Returns:
        the number of completions in the autocomplete menu

        public abstract void acceptCompletion()
        Accepts the selected completion and performs insertion into the document to complete the token.
